intro: Talipariti aruense, commonly known as the Aru talipariti, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
